NPCResponse: Not most of the time, and most of us don't even age. It's something to do with the blue azoth.\n\nIt's just not always predictable - some age, some don't; some die, some don't; and then some come back as Corrupted or Lost.

Oh gosh, I'm not the person to ask. Some people think they have the answer, or so they say.\n\nMaybe the dark part of a person's soul... or maybe some evil disease that takes over the mind... I just know it's not pretty.

I had a feeling you were going to ask that, inappropriate as it may be. \n\nI quite like it here. I used to live in Cutlass Keys, but I got the sense I wasn't wanted. People in Monarch's Bluffs accept me the way I am.

PlayerPrompt: "I spoke to them. Do I make my choice now?"
NPCResponse: Oh, I think so. As rowdy and demanding as they can sometimes be, they are effective.\n\nIf you want to make a difference, here or anywhere in Aeternum, it's really the most efficient way to do so.
Well, that's entirely up to you. If I had your skills however, I'd try my luck in Cutlass Keys.\n\nThey say there's both azoth and gold there for anyone with the pluck to take it.

I mean, you're always welcome here in the inn, but a house offers some amenities.\n\nYou can furnish the place, of course, and if you get yourself killed somehow, you can be resurrected right in the comfort of your own home!

Because it's better out there than in here, for one thing. It's also a place to rest and craft supplies.\n\nAnd then, if you do manage to get in over your head, get killed, it's a convenient place to be resurrected.
We are the solution to a world in chaos. Through strength, discipline, and perserverence, we will enforce our will and bring this land to order.

The Syndicate? Why, we are the learned ones. We use the razor of logic and the guide of reason to understand our world.\n\nWe possess forbidden knowledge. And we will wield the power of this knowledge, just as logic dictates.

In all people, there is a Spark -- an initiative, if you will. In some people, it burns so brightly that others feel it.\n\nWe in the Covenant are the purveyors of the Spark. We foster its growth in all people. We protect the light.

PlayerPrompt: "Why did you give me this dye?"
NPCResponse: You dye your armor with it, if you have time for that sort of thing.

PlayerPrompt: "Why did you give me this dye?"
NPCResponse: What dye? Oh, that Syndicate dye! Why you can use that to turn your boots purple.

PlayerPrompt: "Why did you give me this dye?"
NPCResponse: That dye symbolizes the hearts of all in the Covenant.  Use it to color your clothing, so all will know your affiliation.
No. If the Corruption spreads to Everfall, that's their problem.\n\nWe have to fortify our defenses first, especially with these new reports of Corruption taking hold closer to the settlement.

PlayerPrompt: "What's so great about owning a house?"
NPCResponse: Mah! Now, what kind of question is that? What's not great about homeownership?\n\nA place to store your belongings, a reliable place to fast travel and respawn. Why, it's simply madness not to own a home if you have the gold.

PlayerPrompt: "What did you mean about storage for my home?"
NPCResponse: Storage? You know, places to store your things? \n\nWhen you place that chest I gave you into your home, you'll have even more room to store whatever you need - armor and weapons, furnishings, herbs and spicesâ€¦ whatever you fancy!

I can't make them all that well, but with some effort on your part, you should be able to. They provide a link to the island itself, and provide benefits that you can't otherwise obtain.\nEven better, the benefits follow wherever you are!

You can tell a fishing hotspot is active when you see fish jumping out of it.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotactive.png" height="188"></img>
While it's active, landing your cast within the hotspot will yield quicker bites and rarer fish. When you place your line correctly, you'll see a small alert telling you you've hit the hotspot.

After enough fish are caught at a hotspot it will become depleted. You can tell a hotspot is depleted when there are no fish jumping.
<img src="lyshineui/images/tooltipimages/fishinghotspotdepleted.png" height="188"></img>
A depleted hotspot will become active again after some time has passed.

As your fishing skill improves, you will be able to find more and better hotspots.
